questions.question: Why did Franz skip studies earlier? (Variant 51)
questions.answer: He found lessons boring and avoided work.

questions.question: Why did villagers attend school? (Variant 52)
questions.answer: They respected Hamel and mourned the loss.

questions.question: How does Hamel show love for French? (Variant 53)
questions.answer: He taught with passion and pride.

questions.question: Why was the class unusually silent? (Variant 54)
questions.answer: Everyone sensed the importance of the moment.

questions.question: Why is language linked to identity? (Variant 55)
questions.answer: It carries history, stories and culture.

questions.question: Why did soldiers ban French teaching? (Variant 56)
questions.answer: To control minds of the occupied people.

questions.question: How did Hamel honour the last day? (Variant 57)
questions.answer: He dressed neatly and taught without anger.

questions.question: What emotions fill Franz at the end? (Variant 58)
questions.answer: Guilt, love and deep regret.

questions.question: Why did parents blame themselves? (Variant 59)
questions.answer: They sent children to fields instead of school.

questions.question: What does the lesson teach us? (Variant 60)
questions.answer: Protect and respect your language and identity.

questions.question: Explain why the French language became precious after its loss. (Insight 151)
questions.answer: When forbidden, language becomes a symbol of freedom and pride rather than routine learning.

questions.question: Describe Franz’s change of attitude during the lesson. (Insight 152)
questions.answer: He moves from laziness to pride and deep appreciation as he listens.

questions.question: How does M. Hamel represent dedication to teaching? (Insight 153)
questions.answer: Hamel’s discipline, emotion and passion reflect lifelong service to students and culture.

questions.question: Why is the bulletin board important to the plot? (Insight 154)
questions.answer: It alerts villages to harsh changes and removes illusions of normal life.

questions.question: What is the central message for students today? (Insight 155)
questions.answer: Cherish learning now; do not wait until it is too late.
